user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DirClose_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_DirClose_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_dir_table, *token);

    closedir(impl->dp);
    impl->dp = NULL;

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_DirClose_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t OS_impl_dir_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS]
...
typedef struct
{
    DIR *dp;
} OS_impl_dir_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragments in the provided function are syntactically or statically unreachable. The function has a single straight-line control flow: obtain impl via OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET, call closedir(impl->dp), set impl->dp = NULL, then return OS_SUCCESS. There are no conditional branches, loops, multiple returns, or statements after a return that would create dead/unreachable code. The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET expands to &tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(*token))], which is equivalent to &tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(token)] in this usage, so it does not introduce unreachable code. Possible runtime issues (e.g. out-of-bounds index, closedir behaving non-returning, or incomplete type definition elsewhere) are not instances of unreachable code per MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.1 and therefore do not warrant reporting as unreachable-code fragments.
